intro: Haworthia glauca f. jonesiae, commonly known as the Jonesia Haworthia, is a compact, low-growing succulent native to South Africa. It features dense rosettes of fleshy, bluish-green leaves with prominent white tubercles and a waxy coating. The plant produces tall, spindly stems with clusters of small, bell-shaped white flowers during the summer months. It thrives in well-draining soil and requires minimal water, making it ideal for rock gardens or indoor cultivation. Its unique appearance and low maintenance make it a popular choice among succulent enthusiasts.
